Class IdGenerator

java.lang.Object
IdGenerator
public class IdGenerator extends Object
Utility class responsible for generating unique IDs for entities such as customers or accounts.

This class provides simple static methods that auto-increment counters and return formatted IDs like C001, C002, etc.

In a more advanced system, this logic could be replaced with a database sequence.

  • Method Details

    • nextCustomerId

      public static String nextCustomerId()
      Generates a new unique customer ID in the format C001, C002, etc.
      Returns:
      a formatted customer ID string

    • syncCustomerCounter

      public static void syncCustomerCounter(List<Customer> customers)
      Updates the internal customer counter to the next available number based on the list of already existing customers.

      Should be called once after loading customers from file to ensure new IDs continue sequentially.

      Parameters:
      customers - list of customers already loaded from file

    • nextAccountId

      public static String nextAccountId()
      Generates a new unique account ID in the format A001, A002, etc.
      Returns:
      a formatted account ID string

    • syncAccountCounter

      public static void syncAccountCounter(List<Account> accounts)
      Updates the internal account counter to the next available number based on the list of already existing accounts.

      Should be called once after loading accounts from file to ensure new IDs continue sequentially (no duplicates like A001 for different customers).

      Parameters:
      accounts - list of accounts already loaded from file

    • resetAll

      public static void resetAll()
      Resets both counters to start from 1. (Use only for testing or when resetting data files.)

    • setCustomerCounter

      public static void setCustomerCounter(int nextCounter)
      Manually sets the customer counter to a specific next value. Usually called after loading existing data to continue from the highest existing ID.
      Parameters:
      nextCounter - the next number to use for new customers

    • setAccountCounter

      public static void setAccountCounter(int nextCounter)
      Manually sets the account counter to a specific next value. Usually called after loading existing accounts to continue from the highest existing ID.
      Parameters:
      nextCounter - the next number to use for new accounts

    • getCustomerCounter

      public static int getCustomerCounter()
      Returns:
      current next value for customers (useful for debugging)

    • getAccountCounter

      public static int getAccountCounter()
      Returns:
      current next value for accounts (useful for debugging)
